episodeTitle: Coby and Helmeppo's Resolve! Vice-Admiral Garp's Parental Affection!
description: Koby and Helmeppo train rigorously at Marine Headquarters under Vice Admiral Garp's watchful eye. When Garp overhears them discussing their friendship with Luffy, he tests their resolve through combat on the beach. Despite their defeat, Garp recognizes their mental fortitude and officially accepts them as his trainees. Meanwhile, the Straw Hat crew reads newspaper reports about the two former enemies-turned-Marines.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo Begin Training at Marine Headquarters
events.description: The episode opens with Koby and Helmeppo settling into their new life at Marine Headquarters, where they are assigned to washing floors and performing various chores as part of their basic training regimen.
events.significance: Establishes the setting for the episode and shows the humble beginning of their Marine training under Garp's supervision.

quotes.text: How is doing chores going to make me a Marine?
quotes.speaker: Helmeppo
quotes.context: Helmeppo complains about the menial labor during their training

events.title: Garp Watches Over Koby and Helmeppo
events.description: Vice Admiral Garp observes Koby and Helmeppo from a distance as they work harder and faster, motivated by his presence. This shows Garp's parental teaching method of motivating through observation.
events.significance: Demonstrates Garp's unique mentorship style and his interest in the two young Marines' development.

events.title: Rika's Reaction to Koby and Helmeppo's Departure
events.description: At the seafood restaurant in Shells Town, Rika throws a tantrum upon learning that Koby and Helmeppo have left for Marine Headquarters. Her mother Ririka comforts her by assuring her they will return someday as distinguished Marines.
events.significance: Shows the impact Koby and Helmeppo had on Shells Town and establishes emotional connections that will pay off in future appearances.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo Discuss Their Friendship with Luffy
events.description: While taking a break from training, Koby and Helmeppo have a heartfelt conversation about how meeting Luffy changed their lives and inspired them to pursue their dreams of becoming strong Marines. They express gratitude for Luffy's influence on their paths.
events.significance: Reinforces the lasting impact Luffy has on people he meets and establishes the friendship bond between the three characters that will continue throughout the series.

quotes.text: Meeting Luffy changed everything for me. He inspired me to chase my dream.
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby reflects on how Luffy motivated him to become a Marine

events.title: Garp Overhears Koby and Helmeppo's Connection to Luffy
events.description: Vice Admiral Garp secretly listens to Koby and Helmeppo's conversation about their friendship with the pirate Luffy. Despite Luffy being his grandson, Garp shows no visible reaction to hearing Luffy's name mentioned.
events.significance: This is subtle foreshadowing of Garp's relationship to Luffy, which won't be revealed until much later in the series. The lack of reaction is itself significant given their familial connection.

events.title: Garp Decides to Test Koby and Helmeppo's Resolve
events.description: After overhearing their conversation about befriending a pirate, Garp decides to test whether Koby and Helmeppo have the mental fortitude necessary to become Marines despite their connection to Luffy. He takes them to a beach for a physical confrontation.
events.significance: This marks a turning point where Garp shifts from passive observation to active mentorship, setting up their long-term training relationship.

events.title: Koby and Helmeppo Fight Garp
events.description: On the beach, Garp challenges Koby and Helmeppo to fight him to prove their resolve. The two young Marines attack Garp with everything they have, but are completely outmatched by the legendary Vice Admiral's strength.
events.significance: Demonstrates the massive power gap between the trainees and their mentor, while also showing their determination to face impossible odds. This anime-original scene reinforces their commitment to growth.

events.title: Garp Defeats Koby and Helmeppo
events.description: The fight ends with Koby and Helmeppo thoroughly defeated but having demonstrated their willingness to stand up and fight despite the overwhelming odds. Garp is impressed by their mental resolve rather than their physical strength.
events.significance: Establishes that Garp values mental fortitude and determination over raw power, a philosophy that will guide their training moving forward.

events.title: Garp Officially Accepts Koby and Helmeppo as His Trainees
events.description: After the fight, Garp reveals that he was testing their mental power, not their fighting ability. Impressed by their resolve and determination, he officially accepts them as his personal trainees and promises to train them to become strong Marines.
events.significance: This moment establishes one of the most important mentorship relationships in the series. Garp's training will transform both Koby and Helmeppo into powerful Marines, with Koby eventually becoming a SWORD member and hero-level fighter.

quotes.text: I was testing your mental power. You are going to be trained under my supervision.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Garp officially accepts Koby and Helmeppo as his trainees after their test

events.title: Nami Reads Newspaper About Koby and Helmeppo
events.description: Aboard the Going Merry, while the rest of the Straw Hat crew sleeps, Nami reads a newspaper article about Koby and Helmeppo's progress at Marine Headquarters. She looks at the article with particular interest, then glances at Vivi with a worried expression before storing the newspaper in a drawer.
events.significance: Shows that news of Koby and Helmeppo's Marine activities is being publicized, and hints at Nami's concern about the crew's growing notoriety and the strengthening of their opposition.

events.title: Bogard Observes the Training
events.description: Throughout the episode, Bogard, Garp's right-hand man, silently observes the training and testing of Koby and Helmeppo. His presence reinforces the seriousness of Garp's investment in these trainees.
events.significance: Establishes Bogard as a recurring presence in Koby and Helmeppo's training arc and hints at his role as Garp's trusted companion and enforcer.

quotes.text: How is doing chores going to make me a Marine?
quotes.speaker: Helmeppo
quotes.context: Complaining about menial labor during training

quotes.text: Meeting Luffy changed everything for me. He inspired me to chase my dream.
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Reflecting on Luffy's influence on his life

quotes.text: I was testing your mental power. You are going to be trained under my supervision.
quotes.speaker: Garp
quotes.context: Accepting Koby and Helmeppo as his trainees

themes.description: The episode explores the relationship between mentor and student, showing how Garp's unconventional teaching methods focus on mental fortitude rather than just physical strength.
themes.symbolism: The beach battle represents the trials one must face to prove their resolve and earn the right to pursue their dreams.

themes.description: Koby and Helmeppo's dedication to their Marine dreams, inspired by Luffy's pursuit of his pirate dream, shows how determination can transform anyone willing to work hard.
themes.symbolism: Their willingness to fight Garp despite knowing they'll lose symbolizes the courage required to chase seemingly impossible goals.

themes.description: The episode demonstrates how Luffy's influence continues to affect people even after he's gone, inspiring both allies and former enemies to pursue their own dreams.
themes.symbolism: The newspaper article represents how actions and ideals can spread far beyond one's immediate presence.

characterSpotlights.development: Koby demonstrates significant growth from his timid beginnings, showing determination to work hard and face impossible challenges like fighting Garp.
keyActions: Fighting Garp to prove his resolve
Earning Garp's recognition as a worthy trainee
quotes: Meeting Luffy changed everything for me. He inspired me to chase my dream.

characterSpotlights.development: Helmeppo continues his transformation from spoiled brat to dedicated Marine, though he still complains about the hard work required.
keyActions: Complaining about chores but doing them anyway
quotes: How is doing chores going to make me a Marine?

characterSpotlights.development: Garp's character is further established as an eccentric but powerful Marine who values mental strength and determination over raw power.
keyActions: Overhearing their discussion about Luffy without reacting
Accepting them as his personal trainees
quotes: I was testing your mental power. You are going to be trained under my supervision.

mangaDifferences.difference: The fight between Koby, Helmeppo, and Garp on the beach is anime-original content not present in the manga cover story.
The episode is adapted from the Diary of Koby-Meppo cover story that ran across manga chapters 83-119, condensing many installments into this single episode.

trivia.fact: This episode is part of one of only three cover stories that were fully adapted into the anime. The others are Buggy's Crew Adventure Chronicles and the Straw Hat's Separation Serial.

sources.title: Diary of Koby-Meppo - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Despite Garp being Luffy's grandfather, Luffy showed no reaction when Garp's name was mentioned in this episode. This is subtle foreshadowing that takes on new meaning after the relationship is revealed in Episode 314.
The episode achieved a 15.8% TV rating in Japan, ranking 3rd for the week of its broadcast.
The 4Kids English dub completely excluded both episodes 68 and 69 of the Diary of Koby-Meppo arc.

sources.title: Diary of Koby-Meppo - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: The commercial music for Vivi in this episode is different than her usual theme.
